poem:
**Diplomatic Currents**

In the thrum of headlines,  
envoys drift like autumn leaves  
toward the steely Moscow light,  
conversations spiraling in the air  
like a songbird lost mid-flight.  
Yet hope, feathered and fragile,  
perches briefly,  
and we watch from afar,  
the future sketched in shadows  
upon a page of newsprint.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘We have people going to Russia right now,’ says Trump as Zelenskyy hopes for ‘strong steps’ if Russia rejects ceasefire – Europe live 6.55pm GMT White House confirms Trump envoy to visit Moscow this week The White House has confirmed that the US national security adviser, Mike Waltz, spoke to his Russian counterpart today. White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt also said that US envoy Steve Witkoff is going to Moscow this week for talks". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘We have people going to Russia right now,’ says Trump as Zelenskyy hopes for ‘strong steps’ if Russia rejects ceasefire – Europe live 6.55pm GMT White House confirms Trump envoy to visit Moscow this week The White House has confirmed that the US national security adviser, Mike Waltz, spoke to his Russian counterpart today. White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt also said that US envoy Steve Witkoff is going to Moscow this week for talks
